content.description: Pull on to the obvious corner/edge at the bottom right side of the slab, climb straight to the top using good crimps in the horizontal seams on the face.
content.location: Right side of the slab face on this boulder, just before the slab turn more of a low angle.

content.description: Stand start on the arete. Easy climb straight up to the top
Start standing on the lakeside face. Haul up on jugs to the top.  A sit start offers a few more moves and only slightly harder.
content.location: See the link in the description for near dam.

content.description: Start on crimps mid slab. Move straight up on little holds to top out.
Start on the left side of the slab face, just to the right of the arete. Crimp on the holds in the horizontal cracks to get to the top.

If anyone wants to climb it by starting facing outward at the scoop, it’ll be cool. A easy traverse with good movements and great holds. This problem is easier for shorter people. Squat start at a scoop shaped rock feature with both hands on low pinches. Traverse left using any holds you like until you reach the overhang bulge feature. Reach left to the end of the bulge and climb into the corner, continue left to top out over the easy down climb arete.
content.protection: Pads to protect from the small rocks near the bulge.
content.location: Look for big scoop feature with a blocky pinch on the left side and a stripe pinch on the right side. The problem starts slightly to the right of lake side and is to the left of the slab problems.

content.description: A few boulders located just before you reach the dam. One boulder in particular offers a few routes. Lake side face has some jugs to pull on and the tall face has some horizontal cracks with some nice crimps.   Andrew Wilder offers more info on his online guide about this area. web.archive.org/web/2008012…
